III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The facility is located on a residential street in an urban setting several miles to
downtown Kalamazoo and close the campus of Western Michigan University. The
facility is a two-story structure with a large deck coming off of the back door. Upon entry
into the home (facility), there is a small foyer with stairs leading to the second level and
a second set of stairs leading to the first level. When you go up the stairs you enter an
area that can lead to the living room to the right and bedrooms to the left. Going left
towards the bedrooms, you have two full bathrooms on the right side of the hallway and
a closet on the left. Down the hallway, are two bedrooms which are set up for two youth
apiece. There is a large closet in each bedroom along with two windows in the left
bedroom and one window in the right bedroom. Turning right at the top of the stairs
leads you into the large living room with a large window. At the end of the living room is
a doorway leading to the third bedroom which is also set up for two youth. Turning left
after entering the living room you enter the dining room which has the back door on the
outside wall. Facing the dining room, you have a doorway in the right wall that leads to
the office. Turing to the left you have the large entrance to the kitchen. The kitchen
counter runs along three walls and has both upper and lower cabinets. Once entering
the front door and going down the stairs you enter the first level of the facility. Upon
entering the first level and turning right, you enter a large room similar in size to the
living room upstairs. In the far wall is a doorway leading to a fourth bedroom. On the left
wall and at the end of the room, is a doorway that leads to staff space and has a lock on
the door. Next to this doorway is a doorway leading to the utility/laundry room which is
also locked. Next to the utility/laundry room are two full bathrooms. If you turn left at the
bottom of the stairs you walk a very short hallway to the therapy room on the left and
computer room on the right. Between the therapy room and stairs is a small closet. This
home (facility) is very well kept and decorated in a family style.
B. Program Description
Pine Way Group Home South is a community based residential program located in
Kalamazoo with a mission statement to “provide provisional respite to young males with
the safety, support, and structure, to successfully transition into permanent placement
and become successful members of society”. The program will serve 6 male youth
between the ages of 12 and 17. Youth eligible for the program include those who have a

history of abuse/neglect, mental/emotional instability, parent abandonment, a need to
develop skills for independent living, history of mild substance abuse (only marijuana),
minimal behavioral issues (minimal aggression), at least 30 days without being
physically restrained, difficulty establishing healthy relationships, and/or a history of
sexual abuse is acceptable with at least one year since last assault with no pending
criminal sexual misconduct charges or pending allegations. Youth should have at least
90 days or more without an AWOLP and no AWOLP attempt within the last 24 hours of
referral. The program will provide an average length of stay between six and nine
months with general outcome goals of family reunification, entrance into independent
living or adoption, if applicable. Pine Way Group South will provide supervision for
resident 24/7. Because the residents will attend public schooling, the staff will supervise
youth during school hours by monitoring youth attendance at school (absences and
tardiness) while making themselves available for any need that arises at the school
setting. This program does not use physical restraint with youth.
The program will provide treatment planning with a variety of treatment services.
Psychiatric Services will include consultation (Psychiatric services will be contracted
outside the facility) and psychotropic medication management. Services to be provided
to each youth include individual therapy, group therapy, family therapy, and other
community outreach services if determined necessary and part of the youth’s treatment
plan. Treatment provided through the program involves the Trauma Focused Cognitive
Behavioral Therapy (TFCBT) modality. Educational services will be provided to support
the youth’s educational goals and each youth will be enrolled in a local academic
program that best suits their individual needs. Additional services include tutoring,
advocacy at IEP meetings and coordination of all meetings, mentoring, and athletic
participation. Pine Way Group will also focus heavily on assisting the youth with
acquiring and developing independent living skills. Various topics presented to the youth
will include substance abuse education, health education (hygiene and sexual choices),
money management, public transportation, meal planning/cooking, employment
training, and secondary educational goals. These skills are developed and practiced
through group sessions, phase booklets, individual therapy, and/or community outings.
All youth will be scheduled for and transported to medical appointments, dental
appointments, psychiatric assessments and medication reviews.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
There were no Rule violations found.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of an original license to this Therapeutic Child Caring
Institution, private.
